thread.title: A Knox investor turned their tennis court into a home and a huge profit
thread.title_full: A Knox investor turned their tennis court into a home and a huge profit

author: Ming Haw Lim
title: A Knox investor turned their tennis court into a home and a huge profit
text:
A SAVVY investor has reaped a reward of several hundred thousand dollars by transforming a tennis court into an eye-catching home in Wantirna South.
And in a suburb where house prices have jumped 25 per cent in the past 12 months, other investors are cashing in by subdividing blocks to create new homes.
The investor who paid $515,000 for the tennis court at 19 Wakley Crescent in March last year sold the luxury home he built on the site for $1.73 million at auction on August 8.
The tennis court that was turned into a luxury home site at 19 Wakley Crescent, Wantirna South. Source: Supplied
Five bidders contested a drawn-out bidding war for the property that achieved Wantirna South’s third highest sale price this year.
The price of $3439 per square metre for the property easily exceeded the $1500 to $2000 per square metre that quality homes usually fetch in the suburb.
Harcourts Wantirna sold the French provincial-style home that was on a tight 503sq m block and that had been expected to sell for between $1.3 million and $1.5 million. The sale showed that a new home could achieve top dollar, even on a small block.
The auction of 19 Wakley Crescent, Wantirna South, drew a large crowd. Source: Supplied
Ray White Wantirna director Richard Kurz said several large blocks in the area have recently been subdivided and turned into new home sites.
One homeowner has subdivided a double block to build a new home to take advantage of the surge in house prices. Another is turning their swimming pool area and garage into a new home site.
Ray White Wantirna also sold a tennis court on 600sq m in Cathies Lane. A luxury home had been built on the property that could fetch up to $2 million if put on the market, Mr Kurz said.
He said the investor who bought 19 Wakley Crescent would have made a large profit of several hundred thousand dollars from the sale. Ray White had sold the site that was originally part of a 1400sq m property.
19 Wakley Crescent, Wantirna South, offered prestige fittings. Source: Supplied
The house, located in popular Knox College estate where homes command premium prices, is close to private schools and has easy freeway access.
Wantirna South was recently ranked among Melbourne’s top 10 suburbs for house price growth according to CoreLogic RP Data figures.
minghaw.lim@news.com.au
Originally published as Court transformation provides a nice return
